thread.title: Luke Shaw left out of Manchester United squad again putting Old Trafford future in serious doubt
thread.title_full: Luke Shaw left out of Manchester United squad again putting Old Trafford future in serious doubt

author: Luke Edwards
title: Luke Shaw left out of Manchester United squad again putting Old Trafford future in serious doubt
text:
Football Luke Shaw left out of Manchester United squad again putting Old Trafford future in serious doubt Luke Shaw was left out of the Manchester United squad to play Blackburn and is omitted from the party going to Saint-Etienne Credit: McNulty/JMP/REX/Shutterstock Luke Edwards 21 February 2017 • 3:56pm 
L uke Shaw has been left out of Manchester United’s Europa League squad in yet another snub to the England left-back which raises serious doubts about future at Old Trafford. 
There is even more uncertainty surrounding Shaw’s happiness at United. Although Mourinho has claimed publicly that he has no problem with the full-back and likes him as a player , his prolonged absence from the first team squad suggests otherwise. 
United are leading their Round of 32 tie against Saint-Étienne 3-0 after an emphatic victory in the first leg, yet Shaw has not even been included in the party that flew to France on Tuesday, even though Mourinho has no intention of naming a full strength side and has a cup final to worry about at the weekend. 
Shaw has played just one game for United since the end of November, starting against Wigan Athletic in the FA Cup on January 29 th but he did not figure in last Sunday’s fifth-round win over Blackburn Rovers. Jose Mourinho apparently likes Luke Shaw as a player and has no problem with him Credit: Jason Cairnduff/Action Images 
H is omission from so many matchday squads is likely to be paving the way for his sale in the summer, although again, Mourinho has denied he is keen to do that at the end of the season. 
The player, though, is hugely frustrated at Old Trafford and, having been touted as one of the best prospects in English football when he was at Southampton, his career has gone backwards since he left the South Coast. Luke Shaw's form in 2013-14 propelled him into England's World Cup squad Credit: Ian Walton/Getty Images 
T hat is likely to mean Shaw is keen to leave and there will be plenty of interest in him, with his form at Southampton enough to propel him into the England team when he was still a teenager. 
The left-back is still only 21, but given his lack of football in Manchester, United, who paid £27m for him two-and-a-half years ago, will find it difficult to recoup anything like that amount. 
A lthough he has played well intermittently in a United shirt, Shaw has made only 39 starts since leaving Southampton because of a serious ankle injury last term. Follow Telegraph Football
